info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:58AM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN TALLADEGA AND SOUTHERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 1158 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Logan Martin Lake, or near Pell City, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Talladega, Pell City, Lincoln, Munford, Grant Town, Alpine Bay Resort, Alpine, Logan Martin Lake, Talladega Superspeedway, Honda Manufacturing Of Alabama, Talladega Municipal Airport, Country Club Estates, St. Clair County Airport, Eastaboga, Camp Mac, Jackson Shoals, Jenifer, Cropwell and Howells Cove. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for central and east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
